thread.title: Mark the dates for Catalonia's Wine Festival this October

author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: Mark the dates for Catalonia's Wine Festival this October
text:
ET-Travel offers you events in Luxury, Entertainment, Food, Sports, Music and Nightlife to experience around the world
Folk Festival 
When : October 23- 27, 2015
Where : Jodhpur
- This year's edition of Jodhpur Rajasthan International Folk Festival will start from 23rd and run till the 27th October. Jodhpur RIFF is a unique experience for music lovers from across the world, attracting thousands to its excellent, spell-binding artists from Rajasthan and abroad. Consequent to this vibrant opening variety concert, Mehrangarh Fort turns into a centre of cultural dialogue through music, narrations, dance forms and talks - with musicians and performers converging from across Rajasthan, Brazil, Finland, Ghana, Israel, Scotland, South Africa , Spain and India

Wine Festival 
When : October 7- 15, 2015
Where : Catalonia
- Catalonia's major Cava producing town is Sant Sadurni d'Anoia (85% of national output) which has a Cava Week celebration dedicated to Catalan champagne with a whole range of gastronomic events and concerts. The week's activities get off to a flying start with the inaugural address and ensuing crowning of the Cava Queen. The week continues with a host of dinners, a 300 person bicycle race, an art exhibition dedicated to Cava and a Petanque evening. There are also Catalan folk music concerts, more gourmet dinners, cava symposiums and, of course, the annual Barcelona train ride. Every 12th October 1,000 people from Barcelona board the Cava train bound for Sant Sadurni d'Anoia. Joined at the station by a hoard of carnival characters, including the prerequisite big heads and cabezudos, they are escorted with a glorious fanfare to the town hall and Cava Houses. After a tour of the cellars, followed by lunch and entertainment, they return to the Catalan capital.

National Park Camp 
When : October 28 - 3 November 2015
Where : Arunachal Pradesh
- Namdapha National Park is situated at the southeastern tip of Arunachal Pradesh. Due to great altitudinal variation, diverse habitats occur in the area, from tropical wet evergreen in the lower areas to subtropical and temperate forests, to alpine region in the higher mountains. Tourists can spot five species of hornbills namely Brown, Rufous-necked, Great Pied, Oriental Pied, Wreathed Hornbill, Whitebellied Heron, Pied Falconet, both Greater and Lesser Necklaced Laughing thrush, and Sultan Tit . In addition, mammals like Hoolock Gibbon and Yellowthroated Marten can also be seen. The Northeast is a butterfly watcher's paradise and Namdapha attracts many butterflies like White Dragontail, Popinjay, Great Windmill and more.
